meaning: She washes away the suffering/ afflictions of birth (janma), death (mrtyu) and old age (जरा) ((jarā)) and thus provides rest/relief to her devotees.
commentary:
(This is one name and hence pausing after ‘tapta’ is wrong. Pausing in between during recitation alters the meaning).

Birth (janma), जरा (jarā) (old age) and death (mrtyu) are the 3 tāpatrayās (tapta) that afflict the beings and cause them terrible distress. By alleviating them, She provides happiness (sukha) and rest to her devotees.
